question: what is the revolution period of venus in earth years
api_result:
The revolution period of Venus, which is the time it takes to complete one orbit around the Sun, is approximately 224.7 Earth days. To convert this period into Earth years:

1 Earth year = 365.25 days (accounting for leap years)

So, the revolution period of Venus in Earth years is:

224.7 days / 365.25 days per year ≈ 0.615 Earth years.

Therefore, Venus completes one orbit around the Sun approximately every 0.615 Earth years.
